src:
NOTÍCIA
Brasil inicia Mundial de Atletismo Paralímpico com ouro
07 Nov 2019 by O Povo
O Brasil iniciou nesta quinta (7) a disputa do Campeonato Mundial de Atletismo Paralímpico de Dubai com a conquista de uma medalha de ouro, com Rayane Soares nos 400m da classe T13 (atletas com baixa visão), e de um bronze, com Alessandro Rodrigo no arremesso de peso.
Para ficar com o ouro Rayane completou a prova com o tempo de 57s30. A segunda posição ficou com a portuguesa Carolina Duarte, com 57s46, e o bronze com a ucraniana Leilia Adzhametova, com 57s55.
Arremesso de peso
Além do ouro o Brasil garantiu um bronze no arremesso de peso. O feito foi alcançado por Alessandro Rodrigo, com uma marca de 13m99cm. O ouro ficou com o iraniano Mahdi Olad (14m44cm) e a prata com o croata Miljenko Vucic (14m42cm).
Mundial de Dubai
O Mundial de Dubai 2019, realizado no Dubai Club for People of Determination, reúne cerca de 1.400 atletas de 120 países, que disputam 172 provas até o dia 15 de novembro. O Brasil conta com 43 atletas.
Dúvidas, críticas e sugestões? Fale com a gente
text:
NEWS
Brazil starts Paralympic Athletics World Championship with gold
07 Nov 2019 by The People
Brazil began this Thursday (7) the dispute of the World Paralympic Athletics Championship of Dubai with the winning of a gold medal, with Rayane Soares in the 400m class T13 (athletes with low vision), and a bronze, with Alessandro Rodrigo in the shot put.
To take the gold Rayane completed the race with time of 57s30. Second place went to the Portuguese Carolina Duarte, with 57s46, and bronze with the Ukrainian Leilia Adzhametova, with 57s55.
Shot put
In addition to gold Brazil secured a bronze in the shot. The feat was achieved by Alessandro Rodrigo, with a mark of 13m99cm. Gold went to Iranian Mahdi Olad (14m44cm) and silver to Croatian Miljenko Vucic (14m42cm).
Dubai World
The 2019 Dubai World Cup, held at the Dubai Club for People of Determination, brings together some 1,400 athletes from 120 countries, who compete in 172 races until November 15. Brazil has 43 athletes.
Questions, criticisms and suggestions? Talk to us
